DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma Lymph Node Dissection Performed CPTAC Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to indicate whether or not a lymph node dissection of the neck was performed during the study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma Lymph Node Dissection Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from any of the following anatomic sites: lip and oral cavity, nasal cavity, paranasal sinuses, pharynx, larynx, and salivary glands._A question asking if lymph node dissection was performed during the study.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a salvage neck dissection >20 weeks from the end of RT, with tumour present?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_02
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a salvage neck dissection in the neck not treated with RT at any time after registration with tumour present?
